Application_Facts: Applicants faced threats from FARC but did not seek police help
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review based on four issues: nexus, credibility, state protection, and s. 97 analysis
Credibility_Assessment: Board found story implausible due to lack of personal confrontation or evidence
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of evidence regarding police non-reporting
Absence of direct confrontation with FARC
Governing_Rule: Claimants must prove lack of state protection and nexus to a Convention ground
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence of attempts to seek police protection
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status due to threats from FARC but were rejected by the Board
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed lack of evidence as undermining credibility
Evidence_Issues: Lack of supporting evidence for non-engagement with state protection
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 97
Evidence_Assessment: Negative inference drawn from failure to report to police
Decision_Rationale: State protection finding was reasonable despite errors in credibility assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide evidence of attempted state protection
